oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Making sorghum molasses with electric machinery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph depicts a man stripping sorghum stalks with an electricity-powered machine. He is hand-feeding the sorghum into a grinder to make molasses.

Farmers were large beneficiaries of the electricity created by the Tennessee Valley Authority. The New Deal initiative to harness power from a series of dams along Tennessee River provided the first electricity for millions in the valley. It; was established by Congress in 1933 and continues serving seven Southern states. TVA is the nation's largest public power provider. Sorghum is a food staple for poor and rural people.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agricultural machinery & implements; Farm produce; Home food processing; Sugarcane
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Planning Commission
